speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE I. Westminster. A street.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter two Gentlemen, meeting

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Whither away so fast?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: O, God save ye!

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Even to the hall, to hear what shall become

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Of the great Duke of Buckingham.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I'll save you

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That labour, sir. All's now done, but the ceremony

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Of bringing back the prisoner.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Were you there?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Yes, indeed, was I.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Pray, speak what has happen'd.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: You may guess quickly what.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Is he found guilty?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Yes, truly is he, and condemn'd upon't.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I am sorry for't.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: So are a number more.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: But, pray, how pass'd it?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I'll tell you in a little. The great duke

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Came to the bar; where to his accusations

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He pleaded still not guilty and alleged

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Many sharp reasons to defeat the law.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The king's attorney on the contrary

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Urged on the examinations, proofs, confessions

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Of divers witnesses; which the duke desired

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: To have brought viva voce to his face:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: At which appear'd against him his surveyor;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Sir Gilbert Peck his chancellor; and John Car,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Confessor to him; with that devil-monk,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Hopkins, that made this mischief.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That was he

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That fed him with his prophecies?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The same.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: All these accused him strongly; which he fain

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Would have flung from him, but, indeed, he could not:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And so his peers, upon this evidence,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Have found him guilty of high treason. Much

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He spoke, and learnedly, for life; but all

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Was either pitied in him or forgotten.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: After all this, how did he bear himself?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: When he was brought again to the bar, to hear

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: His knell rung out, his judgment, he was stirr'd

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: With such an agony, he sweat extremely,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And something spoke in choler, ill, and hasty:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: But he fell to himself again, and sweetly

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: In all the rest show'd a most noble patience.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I do not think he fears death.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Sure, he does not:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He never was so womanish; the cause

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He may a little grieve at.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Certainly

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: The cardinal is the end of this.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis likely,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: By all conjectures: first, Kildare's attainder,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Then deputy of Ireland; who removed,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Earl Surrey was sent thither, and in haste too,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Lest he should help his father.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That trick of state

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Was a deep envious one.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: At his return

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: No doubt he will requite it. This is noted,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And generally, whoever the king favours,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The cardinal instantly will find employment,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And far enough from court too.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: All the commons

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Hate him perniciously, and, o' my conscience,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Wish him ten fathom deep: this duke as much

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: They love and dote on; call him bounteous Buckingham,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: The mirror of all courtesy;--

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Stay there, sir,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And see the noble ruin'd man you speak of.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Enter BUCKINGHAM from his arraignment; tip-staves  before him; the axe with the edge towards him;  halberds on each side: accompanied with LOVELL, VAUX, SANDS, and common people

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Let's stand close, and behold him.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: All good people,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: You that thus far have come to pity me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Hear what I say, and then go home and lose me.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: I have this day received a traitor's judgment,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And by that name must die: yet, heaven bear witness,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And if I have a co nscience, let it sink me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Even as the axe falls, if I be not faithful!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The law I bear no malice for my death;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: 'T has done, upon the premises, but justice:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: But those that sought it I could wish more Christians:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Be what they will, I heartily forgive 'em:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Yet let 'em look they glory not in mischief,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Nor build their evils on the graves of great men;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: For then my guiltless blood must cry against 'em.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: For further life in this world I ne'er hope,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Nor will I sue, although the king have mercies

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: More than I dare make faults. You few that loved me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And dare be bold to weep for Buckingham,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: His noble friends and fellows, whom to leave

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Is only bitter to him, only dying,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Go with me, like good angels, to my end;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And, as the long divorce of steel falls on me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Make of your prayers one sweet sacrifice,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And lift my soul to heaven. Lead on, o' God's name.

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: I do beseech your grace, for charity,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: If ever any malice in your heart

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Were hid against me, now to forgive me frankly.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Sir Thomas Lovell, I as free forgive you

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As I would be forgiven: I forgive all;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: There cannot be those numberless offences

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: 'Gainst me, that I cannot take peace with:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: no black envy

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Shall mark my grave. Commend me to his grace;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And if he speak of Buckingham, pray, tell him

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: You met him half in heaven: my vows and prayers

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Yet are the king's; and, till my soul forsake,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Shall cry for blessings on him: may he live

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Longer than I have time to tell his years!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Ever beloved and loving may his rule be!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And when old time shall lead him to his end,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Goodness and he fill up one monument!

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: To the water side I must conduct your grace;

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Then give my charge up to Sir Nicholas Vaux,

speaker: LOVELL
text_entry: Who undertakes you to your end.

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: Prepare there,

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: The duke is coming: see the barge be ready;

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: And fit it with such furniture as suits

speaker: VAUX
text_entry: The greatness of his person.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Nay, Sir Nicholas,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: When I came hither, I was lord high constable

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Yet I am richer than my base accusers,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That never knew what truth meant: I now seal it;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And with that blood will make 'em one day groan for't.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Who first raised head against usurping Richard,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Flying for succor to his servant Banister,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: My father's loss, like a most royal prince,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Restored me to my honours, and, out of ruins,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Made my name once more noble. Now his son,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name and all

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: That made me happy at one stroke has taken

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: For ever from the world. I had my trial,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And, must needs say, a noble one; which makes me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A little happier than my wretched father:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Fell by our servants, by those men we loved most;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A most unnatural and faithless service!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Heaven has an end in all: yet, you that hear me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: This from a dying man receive as certain:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And give your hearts to, when they once perceive

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The least rub in your fortunes, fall away

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Like water from ye, never found again

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Pray for me! I must now forsake ye: the last hour

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Of my long weary life is come upon me. Farewell:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And when you would say something that is sad,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and Train

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: O, this is full of pity! Sir, it calls,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I fear, too many curses on their beads

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That were the authors.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: If the duke be guiltless,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis full of woe: yet I can give you inkling

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Of an ensuing evil, if it fall,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Greater than this.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Good angels keep it from us!

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: What may it be? You do not doubt my faith, sir?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: This secret is so weighty, 'twill require

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: A strong faith to conceal it.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Let me have it;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I do not talk much.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I am confident,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: You shall, sir: did you not of late days hear

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: A buzzing of a separation

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Between the king and Katharine?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Yes, but it held not:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: For when the king once heard it, out of anger

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He sent command to the lord mayor straight

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: To stop the rumor, and allay those tongues

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That durst disperse it.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: But that slander, sir,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Is found a truth now: for it grows again

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Fresher than e'er it was; and held for certain

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: The king will venture at it. Either the cardinal,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Or some about him near, have, out of malice

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: To the good queen, possess'd him with a scruple

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That will undo her: to confirm this too,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Cardinal Campeius is arrived, and lately;

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: As all think, for this business.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis the cardinal;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And merely to revenge him on the emperor

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: For not bestowing on him, at his asking,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The archbishopric of Toledo, this is purposed.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I think you have hit the mark: but is't not cruel

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That she should feel the smart of this? The cardinal

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Will have his will, and she must fall.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: 'Tis woful.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: We are too open here to argue this;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Let's think in private more.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Exeunt
